summary: Subsets reads from a SAM or BAM file by applying one of several filters.

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Which filter to use.
arguments.name: --FILTER

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: The SAM or BAM file that will be filtered.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: Interval List File containing intervals that will be included in the OUTPUT when using FILTER=includePairedIntervals
arguments.name: --INTERVAL_LIST

arguments.summary:
Filters the INPUT with a javascript expression using the java javascript-engine, when using FILTER=includeJavascript.  The script puts the following variables in the script context: 
 'record' a SamRecord ( https://samtools.github.io/htsjdk/javadoc/htsjdk/htsjdk/samtools/SAMRecord.html ) and 
  'header' a SAMFileHeader ( https://samtools.github.io/htsjdk/javadoc/htsjdk/htsjdk/samtools/SAMFileHeader.html ).
 all the public members of SamRecord and SAMFileHeader are accessible. A record is accepted if the last value of the script evaluates to true.
arguments.name: --JAVASCRIPT_FILE

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: SAM or BAM file for resulting reads.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: File containing reads that will be included in or excluded from the OUTPUT SAM or BAM file, when using FILTER=includeReadList or FILTER=excludeReadList.
arguments.name: --READ_LIST_FILE

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: SortOrder of the OUTPUT file, otherwise use the SortOrder of the INPUT file.
arguments.name: --SORT_ORDER

arguments.summary: The tag to select from input SAM/BAM
arguments.name: --TAG

arguments.summary: The tag value(s) to filter by
arguments.name: --TAG_VALUE

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: Create <OUTPUT>.reads file containing names of reads from INPUT and OUTPUT (for debugging purposes.)
arguments.name: --WRITE_READS_FILES

description:
Summary

Subsets a SAM file by either selecting or excluding certain reads

Details

Subsets a SAM or BAM file by either excluding or selecting reads as specified by FILTER. Other parameters influence the behavior of the FILTER algorithm as described below.

Usage examples

Filter by queryname:

 java -jar picard.jar FilterSamReads \
       I=input.bam \
       O=output.bam \
       READ_LIST_FILE=read_names.txt \
       FILTER=includeReadList

Filter by interval:

 java -jar picard.jar FilterSamReads \
       I=input.bam \
       O=output.bam \
       INTERVAL_LIST=regions.interval_list \
       FILTER=includePairedIntervals

Filter reads having a (2-base or more) soft clip on the beginning of the read:

 cat < script.js
 // reads having a soft clip larger than 2 bases in start of read
 function accept(rec) {
     if (rec.getReadUnmappedFlag()) return false;
     var cigar = rec.getCigar();
     if (cigar == null) return false;
     var ce = cigar.getCigarElement(0);
     return ce.getOperator().name() == "S" && ce.length() > 2;
 }

 accept(record);
 EOF

 java -jar picard.jar FilterSamReads \
       I=input.bam \
       O=output.bam \
       JAVASCRIPT_FILE=script.js \
       FILTER=includeJavascript
name: FilterSamReads
